result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin R Fuja was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 91 Days, If Revoked.
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Any Current Sentence.

Court would approve early termination of Probation after 3 years, if all conditions have been met.

Concurrent with: Any Current Probation.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution of $2,033.33 to be paid, jointly and severally liable, as a Condition of Probation as follows:  $885.00 to E.H.; $1,148.33 to American Family Insurance.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Follow through with any AODA treatment/counseling deemed appropriate by Agent.

No contact with Co-Defendants.
No contact with victim.

Court Costs Waived.
DNA Surcharge Waived.
DNA Sample Waived.

Cash bail to be refunded to poster.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  6 Months - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED for use by Agent pending completion of Jail sentence in Milwaukee County and pending successful completion of Day Report Center in Milwaukee County.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Benjamin R Fuja in court, in custody, with attorney Jean M. Kies.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 6 years (Initial Confinement: 3 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years) CONSECUTIVE to any current sentence. STAYED.  Credit for 91 days if revoked.
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 4 years Probation CONCURRENT with any current probation.  Court would approve early termination of probation after 3 years if all conditions have been met.
- Cash bail to be refunded to poster
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Restitution of $2,033.33 to be paid (jointly and severally liable) as a Condition of Probation as follows:  $885.00 to E.H.; $1,148.33 to American Family Insurance
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  No contact with codefendants.  No contact with victim.  Follow through with any AODA treatment/counseling deemed appropriate by Agent. 
CONDITION TIME: 6 months - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED for use by Agent pending completion of jail sentence in Milwaukee County and pending successful completion of Day Report Center in Milwaukee County.
